abstract: UBS should have been felled by the colossal mistakes in its investment bank and wealth management arm. Somehow it hasn’t been, yet.
snippet: UBS should have been felled by the colossal mistakes in its investment bank and wealth management arm. Somehow it hasn’t been, yet.
lead_paragraph: It feels as though Cary Kochman should turn out the lights in the American investment banking offices of UBS. Mr. Kochman, the global co-head of the UBS’s mergers and acquisitions unit, is leaving for Citigroup — the latest to join in a parade worthy of Macy’s on Thanksgiving. Yet even with the multiyear exodus, UBS has clung to clients. Crushing a big advisory franchise isn’t easy.

headline.main: UBS Is Surviving in Spite of Itself

byline.original: By Jeffrey Goldfarb and Margaret Doyle
